title: UV protection: lenses make a clear difference
text: Learn more about UV protection One more pair of trainers. A new suede coat. That plaid shirt that goes so well with my crepe culottes… Since starting my blog, The Lovely List, I find myself constantly curating my fashion wish-list. Even when I’m not looking for anything in particular, I’ll idly load and unload my Net-a-Porter shopping cart while watching The X Factor . And when I happen to glance up, I’m met by major side-eye from my husband. “Do you really need another polo-neck jumper?” The answer is usually "No." The lenses stay completely clear indoors, and when I step out into direct sunlight, they transition quickly Thankfully, with glasses it’s another story. Essilor makes lenses that are specifically suited to different needs, so I can reassure myself that there’s actually a valid reason for owning multiple pairs. Crizal Prevencia Lenses are perfect for people who spend long hours in front of a computer, as they reduce glare and block out harmful rays of blue-violet light emitted from internal lighting. As an editor, I spend around nine hours in the office and then another two working on my blog when I get home – so it’s safe to say I’m the ideal candidate. When I first received the glasses, I was mostly excited about the black Oliver Peoples frames I had chosen, but after just a few hours of wearing them, I was equally pleased with the lenses. The reduced glare is easy to notice, and it’s nice knowing my eyes are more protected. The Transitions Signature VII Lenses, which darken in sunlight, are another good option. I’m a bit of a sunglasses fanatic, but when I wear my traditional glasses I’m forced to forgo sunnies and suffer the sun. Having a pair that can do double duty is brilliant. Crizal Prevencia Lenses reduce glare when working at a computer The lenses – which I had fitted in a pair of oversized Ray-Bans – stay completely clear indoors, and when I step out into direct sunlight, they transition quickly. They’re also great for popping out of the office to snap a few Instagram pictures without needing to switch to contacts. Even better, they have an Eye-Sun Protection Factor (E-SPF) of 25+, keeping my eyes safe from UV light. Now if only I could find a convincing argument for purchasing three different pairs of leopard heels. . . Clear view Crizal UV Protective Lenses not only protect the eyes against harmful UV light, but they also reduce glare when working at a computer, watching TV or driving at night. The lenses physically repel dust and water, and are also smudge-resistant.
